title: Acid dragon
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all dragons, see [list of dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons").*

| acid dragon D [![Acid dragon.png](/images/9/9e/Acid_dragon.png)](/File:Acid_dragon.png) |                                                                                    |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                          | 18-37                                                                              |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                              | 5                                                                                  |
| [XP](/XP "XP")                                                                          | 155                                                                                |
| [Speed](/Monster_speed "Monster speed")                                                 | 10                                                                                 |
| [AC](/Armour_class "Armour class")                                                      | 5                                                                                  |
| [EV](/Evasion "Evasion")                                                                | 10                                                                                 |
| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                          | 20                                                                                 |
| Attack1                                                                                 | 15 ([bite](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour")) |
| Attack2                                                                                 | 6 ([claw](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))  |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                 | [rAcid](/Acid "Acid") [rPois+](/Poison "Poison")                                   |
| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                       | None                                                                               |
| [Habitat](/Habitat "Habitat")                                                           | Land                                                                               |
| [Intelligence](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence")                            | [Animal](/Category:Animal_intelligence "Category:Animal intelligence")             |
| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                                        | [Uses nothing](/Category:Uses_nothing "Category:Uses nothing")                     |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                        | [Natural](/Category:Natural_holiness "Category:Natural holiness")                  |
| [Size](/Size "Size")                                                                    | [Large](/Category:Large_monsters "Category:Large monsters")                        |
| [Type](/Type "Type")                                                                    | dragon, acid dragon                                                                |
| Flags                                                                                   | [Flying](/Flying "Flying") [Warm-blooded](/Blood_temperature "Blood temperature")  |

|   |                                                                                       |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A small dragon with brilliant yellow scales, its mouth dripping with corrosive slime. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Acid dragons** are one of the easier dragons you'll encounter. They can breathe [acid](/Acid "Acid"), dealing significant damage and possibly corroding you. As with other dragons, their breath attacks have a cooldown.

Like other dragons, killing it may drop [acid dragon scales](/Acid_dragon_scales "Acid dragon scales") (33% chance).

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                            |                                                                                                                                                               |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Spit Acid](/Spit_Acid "Spit Acid") (3d14) | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Noisy flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- [Corrosion resistance](/Corrosion_resistance "Corrosion resistance") will reduce the damage of its acid breath, though it's reasonable to fight acid dragons without.
- If you do get corroded, reassess the situation. If you're confident you can kill the dragon even with the penalties to AC and weapon attacks, do so, but if you were having difficulty before getting hit in the face with acid, or if there are other dangerous monsters about, it might be a good idea to [teleport](/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation").
  - Spellcasting and Evocations aren't hindered by corrosion, so if your weapons aren't working anymore, try switching tactics.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Spit Acid only had 3d7 base damage, but dealt an extra 4d5 "acid splash" damage to players.
- Acid dragons were introduced in [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), replacing [mottled dragons](/Mottled_dragon "Mottled dragon").
html:
Acid dragon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all dragons, see list of dragons.

acid dragon D 
HP 18-37
HD 5
XP 155
Speed 10
AC 5
EV 10
Will 20
Attack1 15 (bite: plain)
Attack2 6 (claw: plain)


Resistances rAcid
rPois+
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type dragon, acid dragon
Flags Flying
Warm-blooded
A small dragon with brilliant yellow scales, its mouth dripping with corrosive slime.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Acid dragons are one of the easier dragons you'll encounter. They can breathe acid, dealing significant damage and possibly corroding you. As with other dragons, their breath attacks have a cooldown.

Like other dragons, killing it may drop acid dragon scales (33% chance).

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Spit Acid (3d14) Natural flag,
Breath flag,
Noisy flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Corrosion resistance will reduce the damage of its acid breath, though it's reasonable to fight acid dragons without.
  • If you do get corroded, reassess the situation. If you're confident you can kill the dragon even with the penalties to AC and weapon attacks, do so, but if you were having difficulty before getting hit in the face with acid, or if there are other dangerous monsters about, it might be a good idea to teleport.
    • Spellcasting and Evocations aren't hindered by corrosion, so if your weapons aren't working anymore, try switching tactics.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Spit Acid only had 3d7 base damage, but dealt an extra 4d5 "acid splash" damage to players.
  • Acid dragons were introduced in 0.20, replacing mottled dragons.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Acid_dragon&oldid=75850"

{{version030}}
{{list of | dragons}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Acid dragons''' are one of the easier dragons you'll encounter. They can breathe [[acid]], dealing significant damage and possibly corroding you. As with other dragons, their breath attacks have a cooldown.

Like other dragons, killing it may drop [[acid dragon scales]] (33% chance).

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*[[Corrosion resistance]] will reduce the damage of its acid breath, though it's reasonable to fight acid dragons without.
*If you do get corroded, reassess the situation. If you're confident you can kill the dragon even with the penalties to AC and weapon attacks, do so, but if you were having difficulty before getting hit in the face with acid, or if there are other dangerous monsters about, it might be a good idea to [[scroll of teleportation|teleport]].
**Spellcasting and Evocations aren't hindered by corrosion, so if your weapons aren't working anymore, try switching tactics.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.28]], Spit Acid only had 3d7 base damage, but dealt an extra 4d5 "acid splash" damage to players.
*Acid dragons were introduced in [[0.20]], replacing [[mottled dragon]]s.
